text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Inbal Shani.

I'm the general manager
of AWS Elastic Containers.
I've been with AWS for a year and a half

but overall with Amazon for
more than five years now.
I'm what is called a boomerang.
So I left Amazon

and for two years I worked
for a different company

and I came back a year and
a half ago to work for AWS.
So I started my career in Amazon Devices
and then I had few roles in consumer.

And then my last role before
I left Amazon was in robotics.
I had the chance to build Scout
which is Amazon delivery robot.
I was previously on the other side,
was building applications by myself
in the other side of Amazon.

And going back to AWS and now
being my own worst customer
in trying to build a solution
that helps customer be successful,

someone that used to be
me, was very challenging
and very tempting for me to come back.

So I decided to join AWS
and take this opportunity.
It feels like I never left.

Amazon lives and dies by
our leadership principle

which is something that
always resonated well with me
as well as our documenting culture.

There's a lot of things
that just make sense,
they just click when you work for Amazon
and kind of taking a break and coming back

and kind of jumping again
into that culture was amazing.
It's always day one.
You always feel like you're working
in a big startup organization

that is a bunch of
startups working together
and it just works like magic.

There are two things that make
leadership in AWS different.

I think the first one is the
ability to build innovation
in a very fast pace

and really taking
something from zero to one.

So if you're a builder,
if you're innovator,

you're really going to
enjoy your time here.

I think the second thing
is really the opportunity
to build things that deliver huge impact.

If you think about the
amount of customers,

the amount of developers that
AWS help empower every day.
If you are passionate about innovation,

if you want to deliver
huge impact to customers,

if you wanna change lives, this
is the right place for you.
The ability to deliver such a huge impact
and make such differentiating experiences
for anyone that is moving to the cloud,

and it's going to be
everyone in the near future,
you should think about joining AWS.
It's an amazing place to work.
